item.title: Tomina add a quote by Alan Watts
item.description: "Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth." -- Alan Watts

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "Be clearly aware of the stars and infinity on high. Then life seems almost enchanted after all." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Halldór Laxness
item.description: "For man is essentially alone, and one should pity him and love him and grieve with him." -- Halldór Laxness

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "He was going to live forever, or die in the attempt." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Tomina add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "There ain't no sin and there ain't no virtue. There's just stuff people do." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Gary Paulsen
item.description: "If books could have more, give more, be more, show more, they would still need readers who bring to them sound and smell and light and all the rest that can’t be in books. The book needs you." -- Gary Paulsen

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Lorraine Hansberry
item.description: "The thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely." -- Lorraine Hansberry

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Eugene O'Neill
item.description: "I am so far from being a pessimist...on the contrary, in spite of my scars, I am tickled to death at life." -- Eugene O'Neill

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Gilda Radner
item.description: "I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end." -- Gilda Radner

item.title: Tomina add a quote by William Strunk Jr.
item.description: "Omit needless words." -- William Strunk Jr.

item.title: Tomina add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Elisabeth Kübler-Ross
item.description: "Should you shield the canyons from the windstorms you would never see the true beauty of their carvings." -- Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Wole Soyinka
item.description: "The greatest threat to freedom is the absence of criticism." -- Wole Soyinka

item.title: Tomina add a quote by A.J. Cronin
item.description: "Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, but only saps today of its strength." -- A.J. Cronin

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "I would rather be a superb meteor, every atom of me in magnificent glow, than a sleepy and permanent planet." -- Jack London

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Janet Frame
item.description: "There is no past or future. Using tenses to divide time is like making chalk marks on water." -- Janet Frame

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Anne Tyler
item.description: "I read so I can live more than one life in more than one place." -- Anne Tyler

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Kazuo Ishiguro
item.description: "There was another life that I might have had, but I am having this one." -- Kazuo Ishiguro

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Penelope Fitzgerald
item.description: "To every separate person a thing is what he thinks it is – in other words, not a thing, but a think." -- Penelope Fitzgerald

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Heinrich Heine
item.description: "Where words leave off, music begins." -- Heinrich Heine

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Stephen Hawking
item.description: "We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special." -- Stephen Hawking

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Gilles Deleuze
item.description: "A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window." -- Gilles Deleuze

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Federico Fellini
item.description: "All art is autobiographical; the pearl is the oyster's autobiography." -- Federico Fellini

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Hold fast to dreams, For if dreams die Life is a broken-winged bird, That cannot fly." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Neil Jordan
item.description: "Is it fair to have given us the memory of what was and the desire of what could be when we must suffer what is?" -- Neil Jordan

item.title: Tomina add a quote by Ralph Ellison
item.description: "What and how much had I lost by trying to do only what was expected of me instead of what I myself had wished to do?" -- Ralph Ellison
